alert.note: Alert for Custer; Dewey; Ellis; Roger Mills (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 5:27PM CDT until June 22 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ELLIS...NORTHEASTERN ROGER MILLS...NORTHWESTERN CUSTER AND WESTERN DEWEY COUNTIES... At 527 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles east of Harmon to 4 miles southeast of Leedey to near Hammon, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hammon, Leedey, Butler, Camargo, Putnam, Moorewood, Angora, and Foss Reservoir. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
